result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody David Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

From DE requesting verification that the late May pymt was rec'd.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him that his May pymt was rec'd & his next pymt is due by 6-30-16.  DE stated he will be in on time to make June's pymt.  Includes 14TR5492, 14TR5493, 14TR5494,  15CM568. jaf

Per court order.  15CM568 to be added to current PPA.  DE to continue to pay $25/mo comm 1-30-16.  $10 PPF added.  Includes 14TR5269, 14TR5492, 14TR5493, 14TR5494,  15CM568. jaf
Restitution worksheet - SRN approved $40.00 1/5/16. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski DF: Cody David Nelson appeared. Case called at 8:15. DE has paid $40 restitution. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to 15CM568. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM568. Sentencing arguments. ADA Nieskes updates the court as to the restitution worksheet. Crt orders:
- Costs $443
- Credit for 3 days time served. 
- DE to give DNA sample

Cost will be added to the current payment plan.
Plea hearing at 01-05-2016 08:15 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Cody David Nelson appeared. Case called at 8:29. Atty. Kucinski updates the court and requests a plea hearing. DE will have money for restitution by this Fri.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Final pre-trial at 12-09-2015 08:30 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: M. Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Cody David Nelson appeared. Case called at 9:52. ADA Nieskes believes they are moving towards a resolution and requests another PTC. DE is on probation. Atty. Kucinski agrees.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
Appointing Atty Kucinski. km
Pre-trial conference at 11-09-2015 09:45 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kenneth J. or his residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Cody David Nelson appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.
